A kinematics example: distance traveled under constant acceleration is
$$
s = v_0 t + \frac{1}{2} a t^2.
$$

- Understand concepts of initial velocity \(v_0\) and acceleration \(a\)
- Calculate distance \(s\) given \(v_0\), \(a\), and time \(t\)
- Analyze motion scenarios (constant speed vs. accelerating)
- Solve for time or acceleration when distance is given
